intro: Neobartsia serrata, commonly known as the serrated neobartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Neobartsia serrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
